36_CFR_220.6_e_6.name: Timber Stand Improvement
36_CFR_220.6_e_6.description: Timber stand and/or wildlife habitat improvement activities that do not include the use of herbicides or do not require more than 1 mile of low standard road construction
conditions: No herbicide use OR less than 1 mile of low standard road construction
Must be consistent with agency and department direction for such activities in threatened and endangered species habitat

36_CFR_220.6_e_13.name: Post-Fire Rehabilitation
36_CFR_220.6_e_13.description: Post-fire rehabilitation activities, not to exceed 4,200 acres, designed to stabilize and prevent unacceptable degradation to natural and cultural resources, minimize threats to life or property, or repair/improve deteriorated rangeland ecosystems
conditions: Designed to stabilize and prevent unacceptable degradation
May include revegetation, emergency stabilization, or ecosystem repair

36_CFR_220.6_e_14.name: Trail Maintenance and Reconstruction
36_CFR_220.6_e_14.description: Repair and maintenance of existing roads and trails, including parking areas and campgrounds that do not significantly change design, size, use, or purpose from original construction
conditions: Must be repair/maintenance of existing infrastructure
Cannot significantly change design, size, use, or purpose

36_CFR_220.6_d_4.name: Emergency Fire Suppression Activities
36_CFR_220.6_d_4.description: Fire suppression and post-fire emergency stabilization activities
conditions: Subject to post-action review if significant effects occur

36_CFR_220.6_e_1.name: Roads and Trails
36_CFR_220.6_e_1.description: Construction and reconstruction of trails when no more than 1 mile of new trail is constructed per project
conditions: New trail construction limited to 1 mile per project
May include reconstruction of existing trails
